intro: Seseli stylare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe. Its leaves are narrow and deeply lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seseli stylare is often noted for its delicate structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
